This is more of a general webarchiving rather than crawling wuestion so I h=
ope you'll bear with me ..

We're changing our backend storage at Netarkive=
t, and we need to talk to an API that needs
 to know how much data to read =
from each file - ie we need to give it a record length, or worst case an up=
per bound for the record length. (We actually have a problem there because =
of the way we handle dedups.) Anyway, looking at the CDX spec (https://iipc=
.github.io/warc-specifications/specification
s/cdx-format/cdx-2015/) I noti=
ce that the field "S" is for the compressed record length, but there doesn'=
t seem to be a field for uncompressed record length? n is "arc document len=
gth" but is that payload or complete record?


--
Colin Rosenthal PhD
Senio=
r IT Consultant
Royal Danish Library (Aarhus)

--_000_699956c7e64a4359a7351b48d2ab1357kbdk_
